util.graph_plotter module

util.graph_plotter.graph_plotter(gxl_filepath, img_filepath, color_by_feature, node_style, edge_style, scaling, transparency, current_node)[source]

This function draws a graph on an image.

Parameters

  • gxl_filepath – path to the gxl file with the graph

  • img_filepath – path to the corresponding image file

  • color_by_feature – name of the feature the nodes should be colored by

  • node_style – dictionary with the node style (color and radius)

  • edge_style – color and thickness of edges (color and thickness)

  • scaling – x,y coordinates will be scaled accordingly (in case they are not in pixel)

  • transparency – transparency of the image

  • current_node – the current node selected in the node style option menu

static get_edges(root, shift=0) → list[source]

Get the start and end points of every edge and store them in a list of lists (from the element tree, gxl)

Parameters:

root: root of ET tree shift: int, if the smallest id of the nodes is not 0, then shift the edge indexing to start from 0.

Returns:

list [[int, int]] list of indices of connected nodes

get_features(root, mode)[source]

Get a list of the node or edge features out of the element tree (gxl)

Parameters:

root: root of ET tree mode: either ‘edge’ or ‘node’

Returns:

tuple ([str], [[mixed values]]) list of all node features for that tree ([feature name 1, feature name 2, …], [[feature 1 of node 1, feature 2 of node 1, …], [feature 1 of node 2, …], …])

static get_graph_attr(root) → tuple[source]

Get the information attributes of the whole graph

Parameters:

root: root of ET tree

Returns:

tuple (str, bool, str) ID of the graph, Edge IDs present (true / false), edge mode (directed / undirected)

setup_graph_features()[source]

Parses the gxl file and sets the following graph properties - graph info: graph_id, edge_ids_present and edgemode - node: node_features, node_feature_names, and node_position - edge: edges, edge_features and edge_feature_names
